title: 旧约 - 箴言(Proverbs) - 第 26 章
subTitle: 旧约 -- 箴言(Proverbs) -- 第 26 章 ( 本篇共有 31 章 )

lineList.en: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.
lineList.cn: 夏天落雪，收割时下雨，都不相宜。愚昧人得尊荣，也是如此。

lineList.en: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.
lineList.cn: 麻雀往来，燕子翻飞，这样，无故的咒诅，也必不临到。

lineList.en: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool's back.
lineList.cn: 鞭子是为打马。辔头是为勒驴。刑杖是为打愚昧人的背。

lineList.en: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.
lineList.cn: 不要照愚昧人的愚妄话回答他，恐怕你与他一样。

lineList.en: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.
lineList.cn: 要照愚昧人的愚妄话回答他，免得他自以为有智慧。

lineList.en: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.
lineList.cn: 藉愚昧人手寄的，是砍断自己的脚，自受损害。（自受原作喝）

lineList.en: The legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
lineList.cn: 瘸子的脚，空存无用。箴言在愚昧人的口中，也是如此。

lineList.en: As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.
lineList.cn: 将尊荣给愚昧人的，好像人把石子包在机弦里。

lineList.en: As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
lineList.cn: 箴言在愚昧人的口中，好像荆棘刺入醉汉的手。

lineList.en: The great God that formed all things both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors.
lineList.cn: 雇愚昧人的，与雇过路人的，就像射伤众人的弓箭手。

lineList.en: As a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly.
lineList.cn: 愚昧人行愚妄事，行了又行，就如狗转过来吃他所吐的。

lineList.en: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.
lineList.cn: 你见自以为有智慧的人吗，愚昧人比他更有指望。

lineList.en: The slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.
lineList.cn: 懒惰人说，道上有猛狮，街上有壮狮。

lineList.en: As the door turneth upon his hinges, so doth the slothful upon his bed.
lineList.cn: 门在枢纽转动，懒惰人在床上也是如此。

lineList.en: The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.
lineList.cn: 懒惰人放手在盘子里，就是向口撤回，也以为劳乏。

lineList.en: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.
lineList.cn: 懒惰人看自己，比七个善于应对的人更有智慧。

lineList.en: He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.
lineList.cn: 过路被事激动，管理不干己的争竞，好像人揪住狗耳。

lineList.en: As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,
lineList.cn: 人欺凌邻舍，却说，我岂不是戏耍吗。他就像疯狂的人，抛掷火把，利箭，与杀人的兵器。（杀人的兵器原文作死亡）

lineList.en: So is the man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport?
Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out: so where there is no talebearer, the strife ceaseth.
lineList.cn: 火缺了柴，就必熄灭。无人传舌，争竞便止息。

lineList.en: As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife.
lineList.cn: 好争竞的人煽惑争端，就如馀火加炭，火上加柴一样。

lineList.en: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
lineList.cn: 传舌人的言语，如同美食，深入人的心腹。

lineList.en: Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.
lineList.cn: 火热的嘴，奸恶的心，好像银渣包的瓦器。

lineList.en: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him;
lineList.cn: 怨恨人的用嘴粉饰，心里却藏着诡诈。

lineList.en: When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart.
lineList.cn: 他用甜言蜜语，你不可信他，因为他心中有七样可憎恶的。

lineList.en: Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before the whole congregation.
lineList.cn: 他虽用诡诈遮掩自己的怨恨，他的邪恶必在会中显露。

lineList.en: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.
lineList.cn: 挖陷坑的，自己必掉在其中。辊石头的，石头必反辊在他身上。

lineList.en: A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
lineList.cn: 虚谎的舌，恨他所压伤的人。谄媚的口，败坏人的事。
